strings: What is the best way to secure your account?

answers.option: A long and complicated password because I have good memory.
message: Incorrect! You could forget!.

answers.option: Make the most of Upper and Lower case and also numbers!.
message: Correct! Using each of these features will maximise your account security!

answers.option: With Saradomin's blessing, my account will always be safe.
message: Incorrect! Make sure to take advantage of Upper and lower case!

strings: A player starts asking you about very specific details linked to your account, such as when you created your account, your birthday date, internet provider etc. How should you

answers.option: Answer the questions and ask the player back for their details.
message: Incorrect! These details can be used within the account recovery system and possibly compromise your account. If you're asking the player back, you're unknowingly committing the same offence.

strings: You are part way through the Stronghold of Security when you have to answer another question. After you answer the question, you should...

answers.option: Read the text, but forget the info moments later.
message: Incorrect! You should always remember this info so your account is as safe as possible.

answers.option: Read the text and follow the advice given.

answers.option: Inform Pharaoh staff members by reporting the player on the Discord
message: Correct! By informing us we can have the site taken down so that other players won't have their accounts hijacked by this scam. Remember that Moderators are hand picked by Pharaoh admins. Make sure you don't
give out any personal details or passwords.

strings: What do you do if someone asks you for your password or bank PIN to donate for you?

answers.option: Don't tell them anything and ignore them.
message: Quite good. But we should try to stop scammers. So please report them using the report section on the website.

answers.option: Don't tell them anything and report them

strings: What do I do if I think I have a keylogger or virus?

answers.option: Nothing, it will go away on its own.
message: Wrong! This could mean your account may be accessed by someone else. Remove the keylogger then change your password. Never use personal details for passwords or bank PINs!
